TopicTitle: Apollo style rocket, with 2 stage LM + Rover

Articles.Content:
Album - http://imgur.com/a/CKLPF

Craft file - https://www.dropbox.com/s/spfexq339l...ollo%204.craft

Press 1 too decouple escape tower. Use Abort in case of emergency.

[Older Version]

Craft file here https://www.dropbox.com/s/rogplkkehmzajpj/Mini%20apollo.craft

Edited May 29, 2013 by myth

Looks like Mulbin has some competition! Very nice craft! IÃ‚Â´ll fly it right away!

EDIT:

It flies really nice, lander looks just stunning and the rover looks and drives great. Fuel margins are just right, maybe not the easiest craft for newbies, but for moderately experienced players it is just right.

Edited May 26, 2013 by Tada

I modified it a bit for me that it will reach the Mun using mechjeb. ooh and also you don't have to use a decoupler between the CSM and the MEM they will disconnect if you rightclick the docking port.

I modified it a bit for me that it will reach the Mun using mechjeb. ooh and also you don't have to use a decoupler between the CSM and the MEM they will disconnect if you rightclick the docking port.

Yeah, I only added the separator so newer player's who may not know about this wouldn't get stuck, also the Engine fairing tends to stay stuck to the node until you do a qsave/reload.
This is the best Apollo I've ever seen, I especially like the way you did the lander decent module. Only way to improve it would be to ad some fairings around the lander at launch.

I've started to work on a fairing version.

But at the moment It's having issues when I try to separate the LM from the fairing stage, it keeps breaking the landing legs off.

I'll link the .craft file. If anyone can help improve the design so it separates better I would be pretty happy.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/spfexq339lqrk93/Mini%20apollo%204.craft

The other issue is the extra weight makes the fuel very tight.

Suggestions welcome.

Edit: I've worked out the Clash issue. So this version works, though the fuel is still tight, so make sure you make the most of your fuel reserves.

Edited May 27, 2013 by myth
Very nice craft, I really enjoyed flying it and the rover was phenomenal to drive around the munar surface
IÃ‚Â´ll take a look into it

IÃ‚Â´ll take a look into it

I worked out a solution, as always it was rather simple, and all I had to do was rotate the fairing so the legs where between the angles of the structural panels. Thanks for taking a look though.

The Link has been updated with the current design if you would like to take it out for a whirl.
I would suggest adding sepratrons to help with unpacking of that lander - pulling the spent stage away from it.
That thing is sexy as hell. Good work!

I do like a good Apollo inspired rocket! I really like your lander and Buggy, very different.

Unlike my Apollo (Munbug) yours also won't kill people's computer with part count

I do like a good Apollo inspired rocket! I really like your lander and Buggy, very different.

Unlike my Apollo (Munbug) yours also won't kill people's computer with part count

Thanks. I pretty much started with the Lander + buggy, and just built a rocket to work with it. I wanted to go 3 man like yours, but I couldn't work out a good way of building the lander. Your design for a 3 man is fantastic, even if it kills PC
You should submit this design to HOCgaming test pilot series!
